intro: Sandbergia perplexa, commonly known as the perplexing sandbergia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is distinguished by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery bloom. Its flowers, which appear in late summer, are typically pale yellow to white, with a distinctive central disc. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sandbergia perplexa is considered a species of conservation concern.
